ARTICLE.TITLE: Hope’s Move-In Day handles students, COVID-19
ARTICLE.TEXT:
HOLLAND — First-year students began moving into dormitories Wednesday at Hope College, ready and eager to begin the collegiate experience.

More than 800 first-year students will join the Hope College family this week. The rest of the school’s students will move in this weekend.

Classes begin on Monday, Aug. 17.

Hope College incorporated several steps to limit the spread of COVID-19.

Masks must be worn inside or outside, unless a 6-foot distance can be maintained. Hand sanitizers were available at three designated checkpoints. Portable Plexiglass barriers shielded students at the checkpoints.

"There’s excitement to have students back on campus," said Stacey Headley with the Student Life office.

"It seems like there’s a mix of excitement and nerves."
